newsitem.title: GERMANY: Spanish king condemns ETA killing.
newsitem.headline: Spanish king condemns ETA killing.

text.p: King Juan Carlos of Spain on Wednesday strongly condemned the murder of town councillor Miguel Angel Blanco by the Basque separatist group ETA.
"His murder was as contemptible as the terrorists who killed him," the king told a reception in the Berlin city hall to welcome him to the German capital.
The king, on the first full day of a visit to Germany, also paid tribute to the councillor.
"We Spaniards are all in shock and I feel I must express my admiration for Miguel Angel as a person and for his life," said the king, who arrived in Berlin on Wednesday evening.
The king's language was stronger than comments he made during a rare televised address to the nation after Blanco's funeral on Monday.
In that speech, he said Blanco's death had not been in vain and praised the widespread reaction against the killing.
